newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti sees loss narrowing in Q2.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti sees loss narrowing in Q2.

text.p: Italian information technology group Olivetti said on Thursday it expects to see a second quarter 1997 pretax loss, excluding its interest in mobile phone consortium Omnitel, of 93 billion lire after a comparable loss of 171.2 billion lire loss in the first quarter of 1997.
The group's chief executive Roberto Colaninno told an analysts meeting in Milan that there would be no group capital increase today or later in 1997.
Colaninno said that for the period April-June 1997, the group loss before interest and tax was estimated at 43 billion lire after a loss of 122.80 billion lire in the first quarter.
He said in the first half of 1997, the group expected a pretax loss and before Omnitel of 264.2 billion lire, against a loss of 350.2 billion lire in the first half of 1996.
The loss before interest and tax would be 165.8 billion lire in the first half of 1997 from a loss of 232.1 billion lire.

Asked about a possible capital increase for the group in the analysts meeting Colaninno replied. "This is the moment for consolidating the operating results and carrying forward the strategy, therefore the (capital) increase will not be tomorrow nor in 1997."

On the detailed estimates for the second quarter of 1997, Olivetti Solution (ex-systems and services) is seen with a profit of 10 billion lire from a loss of 38.3 billion in the first quarter, and office equipment group Lexikon a profit of five billion lire after a profit of 7.6 billion lire.
For Olivetti's Telemedia, the second quarter 1997 estimate is for a loss of 120 billion lire after a first quarter loss of 127 billion lire.

On selling off non-core businesses, Colaninno said the process would continue up the end of 1997 and would hope to raise some 300 billion lire, which would have a positive effect on the group's finances of 200 billion lire.
